newsitem.title: USA: Vermont Yankee nuclear plant seen on line Thurs.
newsitem.headline: Vermont Yankee nuclear plant seen on line Thurs.

text.p: The Vermont Yankee nuclear power station was scheduled to return on line Thursday following a refueling outage that began in early September, the operator said on Tuesday.
"We plan to restart tomorrow, and be on line Thursday," said a spokesman for Vermont Yankee Nuclear Power Corp.
The 510 megawatt (MW) facility in Vernon, Vt., which was expected to resume operation last weekend, remained off line for repairs and maintenance.
"We took time to work on some steam valves," the spokesman said.

The nuclear plant is owned by a consortium of New England utilities including Central Vermont Public Service Co (31.3 percent); New England Electric System (20 percent); Green Mountain Power (17.9 percent); Northeast Utilities (16 percent) and Central Maine Power Co (four percent).
